definitions.definition: Extremely offensive or unpleasant ; very annoying , contemptible , or odious .
examples: Throwing stones at the bus is another example of your obnoxious behaviour.

definitions.definition: Unjustly disagreeable , argumentative or objectionable ; brazenly rude .
examples: He was an especially obnoxious and detestable specimen of a man.

definitions.definition: Exposed or vulnerable to something, especially harm or injury .

subdefinitions.definition: Causing harm or injury; harmful , hurtful , injurious .
Deserving of blame or punishment ; blameworthy , guilty .
Under the authority or power of someone; subject , subordinate ; hence, deferential , submissive , subservient .
Followed by to : likely to do something.

main_definition: Extremely offensive or unpleasant ; very annoying , contemptible , or odious .
secondary_definitions: ( of a person ) Unjustly disagreeable , argumentative or objectionable ; brazenly rude .
( archaic or obsolete ) Exposed or vulnerable to something, especially harm or injury .
